fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • "Hero would swim across the Hellespont every night … to see his heart's desire", said a review. Leander was the swimmer; Hero, the woman to whom he swam (Radio review: Back to the Hellespont, 10 May, page 24, G2). •  A letter about the election said that 10% of the UK electorate "voted for parties representing the interests of the 14 million citizens not in England". That should have been about 10 million (We need a more diverse parliament, page 35, 11 May). •  A letter on 6 May, page 37, sought to remind the Liberal Democrats' leader of lines from Samuel Beckett's Worstward Ho, but the extract quoted was not quite verbatim. It should have read: "Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try again. Fail again. Fail better." •  An interview mistakenly described the character Willy Loman as a failed insurance salesman (Another view: Death of a Salesman, 10 May, page 19, G2).
